info.description: The SMS Works provides a low-cost, reliable SMS API for developers. Pay only for delivered texts, all failed messages are refunded.
info.title: The SMS Works

customerid.description: Your customer ID, available from your account area at https://thesmsworks.co.uk/user/login

post.description: Schedules a batch of SMS messages to be sent at the date time you specify

content.description: Message to send to the recipient

destinations.description: Telephone numbers of each of the recipients

schedule.description: Date-time at which to send the batch. This is only used by the batch/schedule service.

sender.description: The sender of the message. Should be no longer than 11 characters for alphanumeric or 15 characters for numeric sender ID's. No spaces or special characters.

tag.description: An identifying label for the message, which you can use to filter and report on messages you've sent later. Ideal for campaigns.

ttl.description: The number of minutes before the message is deleted. Optional. Omit to prevent delivery report deletion.

post.description: Send a single SMS message to multiple recipients

content.description: Message to send to the recipient

destinations.description: Telephone numbers of each of the recipients

schedule.description: Date-time at which to send the batch. This is only used by the batch/schedule service.

sender.description: The sender of the message. Should be no longer than 11 characters for alphanumeric or 15 characters for numeric sender ID's. No spaces or special characters.

tag.description: An identifying label for the message, which you can use to filter and report on messages you've sent later. Ideal for campaigns.

ttl.description: The number of minutes before the message is deleted. Optional. Omit to prevent delivery report deletion.

get.description: Retrieve all messages in a batch with the given batch ID

parameters.description: The ID of the batch you would like returned
parameters.name: batchid

parameters.description: The ID of the batch you would like returned
parameters.name: batchid

get.description: Returns the number of credits currently available on the account

post.description: Schedules an SMS message to be sent at the date-time you specify

content.description: Message to send to the recipient. Content can be up to 1280 characters in length. You will be charged 1 credit for each 160 characters, up to a maximum of 8 credits. Messages sent to numbers registered outside the UK will be charged double credits (i.e. 2 credits per 160 characters, up to maximum of 8 credits).

schema.description: Key/value pair that will be returned to you in the API call response.

schedule.description: Date at which to send the message. This is only used by the message/schedule service and can be left empty for other services.

sender.description: The sender of the message. Should be no longer than 11 characters for alphanumeric or 15 characters for numeric sender ID's. No spaces or special characters.

tag.description: An identifying label for the message, which you can use to filter and report on messages you've sent later. Ideal for campaigns.

ttl.description: The number of minutes before the message is deleted. Optional. Omit to prevent delivery report deletion.

content.description: Message to send to the recipient. Content can be up to 1280 characters in length. You will be charged 1 credit for each 160 characters, up to a maximum of 8 credits. Messages sent to numbers registered outside the UK will be charged double credits (i.e. 2 credits per 160 characters, up to maximum of 8 credits).

schema.description: Key/value pair that will be returned to you in the API call response.

schedule.description: Date at which to send the message. This is only used by the message/schedule service and can be left empty for other services.

sender.description: The sender of the message. Should be no longer than 11 characters for alphanumeric or 15 characters for numeric sender ID's. No spaces or special characters.

tag.description: An identifying label for the message, which you can use to filter and report on messages you've sent later. Ideal for campaigns.

ttl.description: The number of minutes before the message is deleted. Optional. Omit to prevent delivery report deletion.

post.description: Get messages matching your search criteria

schema.description: search parameters for querying the message database

destination.description: The phone number of the recipient. Start UK numbers with 44 and drop the leading 0.

from.description: The date-time from which you would like matching messages

keyword.description: The keyword used in the inbound message

metadata.description: An array of objects containing metadata key/value pairs that have been saved on messages.

schema.description: Key/value pair that will be returned to you in the API call response.

sender.description: The sender of the message (this can be the configured sender name for an outbound message or the senders phone number for an inbound message).

status.description: The status of the messages you would like returned (either 'SENT', 'DELIVERED', 'EXPIRED', 'DELETED', 'UNDELIVERABLE', 'ACCEPTED', 'UNKNOWN', 'REJECTED')

to.description: The date-time to which you would like matching messages

post.description: Get unread uncoming messages matching your search criteria

schema.description: search parameters for querying the message database

destination.description: The phone number of the recipient. Start UK numbers with 44 and drop the leading 0.

from.description: The date-time from which you would like matching messages

keyword.description: The keyword used in the inbound message

metadata.description: An array of objects containing metadata key/value pairs that have been saved on messages.

schema.description: Key/value pair that will be returned to you in the API call response.

sender.description: The sender of the message (this can be the configured sender name for an outbound message or the senders phone number for an inbound message).

status.description: The status of the messages you would like returned (either 'SENT', 'DELIVERED', 'EXPIRED', 'DELETED', 'UNDELIVERABLE', 'ACCEPTED', 'UNKNOWN', 'REJECTED')

to.description: The date-time to which you would like matching messages

parameters.description: The ID of the message you would like returned
parameters.name: messageid

get.description: Retrieve a logged message by the message ID

parameters.description: The ID of the message you would like returned
parameters.name: messageid

get.description: Returns a sample error object for the given error code. Useful for designing code to react to errors when they occur for real.

parameters.description: The code of the error you would like returned
parameters.name: errorcode

get.description: Returns the customer ID to the caller
